Package data

Class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory

java.lang.Object
data.WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory, WeatherStationsPolygonsFactory
public abstract class WeatherDataPolygonsFactory
extends java.lang.Object
A WeatherDataPolygonsFactory is used to construct GeographicPolygons from weather data.

Every one of those factories has a set of weighted WeatherFeatures that define the feature space and it's scaling. Additionally there is the time dimension with a scaling of 1 = 1 hour.

A generated GeographicPolygon then represents the (quantized) weather course at one position over a specific time window.

Implementations may differ in the source data and therefore the amounts of available locations.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Field Details

    • features

      private final java.util.LinkedHashMap<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> features
      The WeatherFeatures and their scaling. This map also defines the order of the dimension as it's iteration order.

    • metadata

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> metadata
      Metadata for all the available positions. This contains information about longitude, latitude and elevation, but might contain some more important values. The Integer keys used may be arbitrary but fixed.

  • Constructor Details

    • WeatherDataPolygonsFactory

      public WeatherDataPolygonsFactory​(java.util.Map<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> features)
      Constructs a new WeatherDataPolygonsFactory object using the given weighted features.

      These define the feature space and it's scaling. A mapping of a feature f to the value x means: Include data about feature f in the Polygons and scale these data values by a factor of x.

      A generated GeographicPolygon then represents the (quantized) weather course at one position over a later specified time window.

      Parameters:
      features - the WeatherFeatures to use and how to scale them

  • Method Details

    • toArray

      public static GeographicPolygon[] toArray​(java.util.List<GeographicPolygon> polygons)
      Converts a List of GeographicPolygons to an array.
      Parameters:
      polygons - the GeographicPolygons
      Returns:
      an array of the given GeographicPolygons

    • create

      public java.util.List<GeographicPolygon> create​(java.util.Calendar startTime) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon dataset from weather data.

      For every available position one of those polygons is created. Every point on its course corresponds to one point in time. The time in hours after the starting time is given by the first coordinate. Every other coordinate represents a weather feature at that position in that point in time.

      The duration of the time window is one day, the time step size 1 hour.

      Parameters:
      startTime - the first point of time to include in the course of the polygon
      Returns:
      the generated dataset
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • create

      public java.util.List<GeographicPolygon> create​(java.util.Calendar startTime, int duration) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon dataset from weather data.

      For every available position one of those polygons is created. Every point on its course corresponds to one point in time. The time in hours after the starting time is given by the first coordinate. Every other coordinate represents a weather feature at that position in that point in time.

      The time step size 1 hour.

      Parameters:
      startTime - the first point of time to include in the course of the polygon
      duration - the duration of the time window
      Returns:
      the generated dataset
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • create

      public java.util.List<GeographicPolygon> create​(java.util.Calendar startTime, int duration, int stepSize) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon dataset from weather data.

      For every available position one of those polygons is created. Every point on its course corresponds to one point in time. The time in hours after the starting time is given by the first coordinate. Every other coordinate represents a weather feature at that position in that point in time.

      Parameters:
      startTime - the first point of time to include in the course of the polygon
      duration - the duration of the time window
      stepSize - the time step size in hours. Must be at least 1
      Returns:
      the generated dataset
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • create

      public java.util.List<GeographicPolygon> create​(java.util.Calendar startTime, int duration, int stepSize, java.util.function.Predicate<double[]> filter) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon dataset from weather data.

      For every available position one of those polygons is created, if it matches the filter. Every point on its course corresponds to one point in time. The time in hours after the starting time is given by the first coordinate. Every other coordinate represents a weather feature at that position in that point in time.

      Filtering the position for which polygons are generated works by providing a Predicate. This predicate can use the positions metadata (see readMetaData()) to decide, whether or not to use that position.

      Parameters:
      startTime - the first point of time to include in the course of the polygon
      duration - the duration of the time window
      stepSize - the time step size in hours. Must be at least 1
      filter - the filter that decides which polygons to generate
      Returns:
      the generated dataset
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • makeWeatherPolygon

      protected abstract GeographicPolygon makeWeatherPolygon​(double[][] data, double[] meta)
      Constructs a GeographicPolygon from the given polygon data and additional metadata that might be required for the specific type of GeographicPolygon.
      Parameters:
      data - the polygon data
      meta - the metadata
      Returns:
      the constructed GeographicPolygon

    • readFeatureData

      protected abstract java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> readFeatureData​(WeatherFeature feature, java.util.Calendar startTime, int timeSteps, int stepSize) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the course of all GeographicPolygons with regard to a single feature.
      Parameters:
      feature - the feature for which the data should be constructed
      startTime - the start time of the time window
      timeSteps - the number of time steps
      stepSize - the time step size in hours
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the a single dimension of the corresponding polygon data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • readMetaData

      protected abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[]> readMetaData() throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the metadata of all available positions and maps them to the positions Integer key.
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the corresponding metadata
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded

    • combineFeatureData

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[][]> combineFeatureData​(java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[]>> valueMaps, java.util.List<java.lang.Double> scalars, int timeSteps, int stepSize)
      Combines the data from multiple weather polygon features with the time values. The resulting data is the multidimensional course of the GeographicPolygons.
      Parameters:
      valueMaps - the mappings from every available position key to the corresponding polygon data
      scalars - the scalars for each feature. Must be ordered like valueMaps
      timeSteps - the number of time steps
      stepSize - the time step size in hours
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the corresponding polygon data

    • generateFeatureData

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​double[][]> generateFeatureData​(java.util.Calendar startTime, int timeSteps, int stepSize) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructs the course of all GeographicPolygons for a given time window.
      Parameters:
      startTime - the start time of the time window
      timeSteps - the number of time steps
      stepSize - the time step size in hours
      Returns:
      the mapping from every available position key to the corresponding polygon data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the data could not be loaded
